branches.name: feature/weighted-edits
branches.rationale: To enhance similarity scoring by allowing certain character substitutions to count differently in edit distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_weights method
commits.body: Added a new method to calculate edit distance with weighted character substitutions.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_weights function to handle weighted edits.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_weights in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new distance_with_weights method.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_weights to the public API.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Documented the new distance_with_weights method in the API documentation.
per_file_changes: Added usage examples and parameter descriptions for distance_with_weights.

branches.name: feature/max-distance-cutoff
branches.rationale: To improve performance by allowing the distance method to return early for inputs exceeding a specified threshold.

src/Levenshtein/levenshtein_cpp.pyx: Implement distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) and similarity(s1, s2, max_dist=N)
src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose new methods in the API

commits.title: Implement distance and similarity methods with max distance
commits.body: Added new methods to handle max distance cutoff for performance improvements.
per_file_changes: Implemented distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) and similarity(s1, s2, max_dist=N).

commits.title: Expose new methods in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new distance and similarity methods.
per_file_changes: Added distance and similarity methods to the public API.

commits.title: Update documentation for new methods
commits.body: Documented the new distance and similarity methods in the API documentation.
per_file_changes: Added usage examples and parameter descriptions for distance and similarity methods.

branches.name: feature/multi-threaded-batch-computation
branches.rationale: To allow faster processing of large lists of strings for similarity ranking through parallel computation.

commits.title: Implement batch_distance method
commits.body: Added a new method for batch processing of distance calculations.
per_file_changes: Implemented batch_distance function for multi-threaded processing.

commits.title: Expose batch_distance in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new batch_distance method.
per_file_changes: Added batch_distance to the public API.

commits.title: Update documentation for batch_distance
commits.body: Documented the new batch_distance method in the API documentation.
per_file_changes: Added usage examples and parameter descriptions for batch_distance.

branches.name: feature/edit-operations-path
branches.rationale: To provide detailed insights into the edit operations performed during distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_ops method
commits.body: Added a new method to output the edit operations path.
per_file_changes: Implemented distance_with_ops function to return edit operations.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_ops in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new distance_with_ops method.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_ops to the public API.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_ops
commits.body: Documented the new distance_with_ops method in the API documentation.
per_file_changes: Added usage examples and parameter descriptions for distance_with_ops.

branches.name: feature/unicode-grapheme-clusters
branches.rationale: To ensure multi-codepoint characters are treated as single units in distance calculations, improving correctness.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose grapheme support in the API

commits.title: Add grapheme support to distance methods
commits.body: Added an optional parameter to support grapheme clusters.
per_file_changes: Added use_graphemes parameter to distance methods.

commits.title: Expose grapheme support in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include grapheme support.
per_file_changes: Added grapheme support to the public API.

commits.title: Update documentation for grapheme support
commits.body: Documented the new grapheme support in the API documentation.
per_file_changes: Added usage examples and parameter descriptions for grapheme support.

branches.name: feature/pure-python-fallback
branches.rationale: To maintain functionality on platforms where the C extension cannot compile, enhancing portability.

commits.title: Create fallback module for pure-Python implementation
commits.body: Added a pure-Python fallback module for compatibility.

commits.title: Add automatic selection logic for fallback
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include logic for selecting the fallback module.
per_file_changes: Added logic to select between C extension and pure-Python fallback.

commits.title: Update documentation on fallback module
commits.body: Documented the fallback module and its usage.
per_file_changes: Added usage examples and performance trade-off information.

branches.name: docs/readme-review-note
branches.rationale: To add a simple line in readme file that says 'reviewed by Bob'.

commits.title: Docs: Add review acknowledgement
commits.body: Added 'reviewed by Bob' line to README.
